title: How the Sessions Work
subtitle: Learning that adapts to you — grounded in proven learning theories and business frameworks.

stages.title: Align
body: Start with where you are today.
We check in to understand your current situation — in your English learning, career, or life.
What challenges and successes have you had recently? What do you want to focus on today and moving forward?
This stage ensures each session is aligned with your real goals, not a preset curriculum.

stages.title: Discover
body: We introduce new ideas connected to your goals — key phrases, business concepts, cultural topics, or references to well-known literature, research, and media.
Discovery links learning to ideas that matter to you, building curiosity and motivation.

stages.title: Practice
body: The focus is output: you speaking, thinking, and experimenting while I guide, prompt, and support.
We dive into conversation, follow-up questions, presentation practice, or simulations — depending on your goals, level, and preferred style.
This stage turns insight into real-world skill.

stages.title: Reflect
body: We pause to reflect on what stood out from today’s session — both challenges and breakthroughs.
What felt difficult? What did you enjoy or notice about your communication style?
After the lesson, you’ll receive a short written summary with key feedback and takeaways to review at your own pace.

stages.title: Apply
body: End every session with clear direction for what comes next.
Together, we identify one or two practical ways to apply what you learned — at work, in daily conversation, or in your studies.
These next steps are also included in your post-session summary so you can keep learning between lessons.
